pullRequest.title: Migrate from Travis to GitHub Actions
pullRequest.bodyText:
This is a drastic simplification of our build matrix, for #3377.
There are relatively few differences between versions of Java, so by testing only with the oldest and the newest we should cover both issues due to deprecation of old APIs (with the newest version, 14) and the use of APIs that are too recent (with the oldest version, 8).
The differences between OpenJDK and OracleJDK are pretty negligible nowadays so it is not worth duplicating tests for both vendors.
The mac OS build had to be removed because it costs more than Linux / Windows builds (although it is not exactly clear how much).
I'll request new credits for the organization to resume builds.

commit.message:
Only keep JRE 8 and 14 in the build matrix.

For #3377.
Run tests in GitHub Actions on each PR
Set explicit password for Postgres on GitHub Actions
Set explicit password for MySQL and MariaDB
Fix credentials for postgres and mysql
Fix duplicate id in GitHub workflow

nodes.bodyText:
@wetneb Wait, I'm confused here on this fetch-depth line.  I don't see the git describe need. Where at?  I see git describe used in the refine script for mac_dist() which says no longer used in a comment, and then also for broker_build() and broker_appengine_build().  Are those even run or needed now since we now do "mvn package" ?  For our PR workflow, I think we just care about what the last tag was on master, no?  Or even just 'heads/master' ?
E:\GitHubRepos\OpenRefine>git describe --tags --first-parent --all
heads/master

BTW, we also have access to the environment variable in the runner at any time with GITHUB_REF which represents the PR merge branch refs/pull/:prNumber/merge as shown in docs https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/actions/reference/events-that-trigger-workflows#pull_request
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+name: Java CI
+
+on: [pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  build:
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    services:
+      postgres:
+        image: postgres
+        env:
+          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
+          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: 'postgres'
+          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
+        options: >-
+          --health-cmd pg_isready
+          --health-interval 10s
+          --health-timeout 5s
+          --health-retries 5
+
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/checkout@v2.3.4
+      with:
+        fetch-depth: 0 # This is wasteful, but needed for git describe

commit.message: Fix creation of test_db on MySQL
Revert back to GH Action MySQL service
Reorder steps to give more time for MySQL to boot

nodes.bodyText: Do we want to pin this? Based on the update to Ubuntu 20, it looks like they're happy to include updates of installed versions which have breaking changes.
I think we can probably run MySQL as a service too, along the lines of https://firefart.at/post/using-mysql-service-with-github-actions/, including the "wait for availability" check
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,66 @@
+name: Java CI
+
+on: [pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  build:
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    services:
+      postgres:
+        image: postgres
+        env:
+          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
+          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: 'postgres'
+          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
+        options: >-
+          --health-cmd pg_isready
+          --health-interval 10s
+          --health-timeout 5s
+          --health-retries 5
+
+    steps:
+    - name: Create test MySQL database
+      id: create_test_db
+      uses: mirromutth/mysql-action@v1.1
+      with:
+        host port: 3306
+        container port: 3306
+        mysql database: 'test_db'
+        mysql root password: 'root'

nodes.bodyText: Perhaps precede this with a "wait for databases to be available" check?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,66 @@
+name: Java CI
+
+on: [pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  build:
+
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    services:
+      postgres:
+        image: postgres
+        env:
+          POSTGRES_USER: postgres
+          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: 'postgres'
+          POSTGRES_DB: test_db
+        options: >-
+          --health-cmd pg_isready
+          --health-interval 10s
+          --health-timeout 5s
+          --health-retries 5
+
+    steps:
+    - name: Create test MySQL database
+      id: create_test_db
+      uses: mirromutth/mysql-action@v1.1
+      with:
+        host port: 3306
+        container port: 3306
+        mysql database: 'test_db'
+        mysql root password: 'root'
+
+    - uses: actions/checkout@v2.3.4
+
+    - name: Restore dependency cache
+      uses: actions/cache@v2.1.3
+      with:
+        path: ~/.m2/repository
+        key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+        restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+
+    - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+      uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+      with:
+        java-version: 1.8
+
+    - name: Configure connections to databases
+      id: configure_db_connections
+      run: cp extensions/database/tests/conf/github_actions_tests.xml extensions/database/tests/conf/tests.xml 
+
+    - name: Populate databases with test data

commit.message: Run MySQL database as a service, forward ports to config
Fix connection to MySQL and Postgres
Add back explicit database creation steps
Remove explicit creation of test database for postgres
Attempt to use Coveralls maven plugin instead of GH action
Also update appveyor script after rename of SQL files
